verses.verse: Trust is a basis of things that are anticipated, a validation of items that are not seen.
You see, in this the older men were witnessed by others.
With trust, we are aware for the spans of time to have been developed by God's statement for the "for the things that are seen to not have come into existence from things that appear" part.

With trust, Abel offered up to God more of a sacrifice than Cain, through which he was witnessed by others to be right, God telling what He witnessed based on his contributions. And through it, after dying, he still speaks.

With trust, Enoch was transferred, of the "to not see death" kind, and he was not being found because God transferred him. You see, before his transfer, he had been witnessed by others to have been very satisfying to God.

Without trust it is impossible to be very satisfying to Him. You see, it is necessary for the person who comes to God to trust that He is and He becomes a payer of earnings to the people searching Him out.

With trust, when Noah was divinely notified about the things not yet seen, after taking it seriously, he designed a box for the rescue of the people of his house, through which he found the world guilty and became an inheritor of the right way that is in line with trust.
With trust, a man called Abraham obeyed to go out to the place that he was going to be receiving for an inheritance. And he went out, not even aware of where he is going.
With trust, he was a local foreigner in the land of the promise, as land belonging to others, who resided in tents with Isaac and Jacob, the inheritors together of the promise, the same promise.
You see, he was waiting for the city that had the foundations, whose skilled worker and craftsman is God.
With trust, also Sarah herself received the ability for the founding of a seed and delivered beyond the right time in age since she regarded the One who promised to be trustable.

For this reason, also out of one who had been dead, even these descendents were born to the large number, just as the constellations of the sky and as if they were the sand along the shore of the sea, the countless sand.
In line with trust, these all died after not receiving the promises, but after seeing them from far away, greeting them, and acknowledging that they are strangers and refugees on the earth.
You see, the people saying these types of things make it apparent that they are looking for a hometown.
And certainly if they were remembering that hometown that they came out away from, they would have had a time to double back.

But right now they are reaching out for a better hometown (that is, a heavenly hometown). For this reason, God is not ashamed of them, to also be called their God. You see, He got a city ready for them.
With trust, Abraham had offered Isaac up, being troubled. And he was offering up the only biological son, he, the one who welcomed the promises in,
to whom it was spoken, "In Isaac, a seed will be called to you."
After he considered that God is able to be getting him up, even from the dead, from this he retrieved him, also in an illustration.
With trust, concerning things that were going to come, Isaac conferred prosperity on Jacob and Esau.
With trust, Jacob, as he was dying, conferred prosperity on each of the sons of Joseph, and bowed down over the edge of his staff.
With trust, Joseph, as he was passing away, remembered about the exit of the sons of Israel and demanded them about his bones.
With trust, Moses, after being born, was hidden for a three-month period by his parents because they saw the young child to be well behaved and they didn't fear the ruling of the king.
With trust, Moses, after he became great, denied to be called a son of Pharaoh's daughter,
after choosing rather to be mistreated together with the ethnic group of God than to be having enjoyment of sin for the time being,
who regarded the insult of the Anointed King as greater wealth than the treasures of Egypt. You see, he was looking off to the earned payment.
With trust, he left Egypt down there, not fearing the anger of the king. You see, he was empowered by the invisible One, as if seeing Him.
With trust, he has done the Passover and the public spilling of the blood so that the one destroying the firstborn children would not come into contact with them.
With trust, they walked across the Red Sea as across dry land, that after the Egyptians received trouble, they were swallowed up by it.
With trust, the walls of Jericho fell after being surrounded over seven days.
With trust, Rahab, the prostitute, was not ruined together with the people who didn't believe after she accepted the spies with peace.
And what else may I say? You see, the time will leave on me describing about Gideon, Barak, Samson, and Jephthah; David, Samuel, and the preachers,
who through trust struggled against empires, worked for the right way, obtained promises, shut lions' mouths,
extinguished fire's ability, escaped the edges of a knife, received ability out of weakness, became strong in war, tilted over barracks of soldiers belonging to others.
Women received their dead from a return back to life. Others were clubbed to death after not accepting the paid release so that they might obtain a better return back to life.
Different people received trouble from incidents of mockery and whips, but still others from restraints and jail.

They were attacked with stones. They were sawed up. They experienced trouble. They died in a murder with a knife. They went around in sheepskins, in goat skins, lacking, going through hard times, being mistreated
(of whom the world was not deserving), wandering around in uninhabited places, mountains, caves, and the cavities of the earth.
And these all (who were witnessed by others through the trust) did not retrieve the promise
of God who beforehand looked out for something better concerning us, that they would not be completed without us.
